participant_1.background:
I am comfortable with my own style and don't mind being different.
I like to wear the same pants every day so I don't have to think about what to wear.
Monkeys are my favorite animal because they are so smart and playful.
my hair is brown and curly.
I spend my days working as a software engineer and watching makeup tutorials in my spare time, while also trying to find common ground with my father.

participant_2.background:
I am happy with my parents.
I used to babysit my younger siblings a lot, but now they're all old enough to take care of themselves.
My first major purchase was my laptop, and I still use it every day.
My goal is to be a great teacher and inspire my students to be the best they can be.
i once saw peyton manning at the grocery store.

content.text: Hey, how are you today?
I'm doing well, thanks! How are you?
I'm doing good too. What do you like to do for fun?
I enjoy watching movies and hanging out with friends. What about you?
I like to watch movies too, but I also like to read and go for walks.
Reading is great! I used to read a lot more when I was younger. What kind of books do you like to read?
I like to read a variety of books, but I usually read fantasy or historical fiction.
Oh, that's cool. I like to read nonfiction books about history and science.
I used to read a lot more non-fiction books when I was in school, but I don't have as much time for them anymore.
I know what you mean. I used to read a lot more when I was younger, but now I have a lot more responsibilities.
Yeah, me too. But it's nice to have some time to relax and read a good book.
Exactly! I always feel better after I've read a good book.
Me too. It's like a great escape from the real world.
Yeah, it's like I can forget about all my problems and just focus on the story.
Exactly!
What's your favorite book that you've ever read?
That's a hard question, but I think I'd have to say "The Lord of the Rings" by J.R.R. Tolkien.
Oh, that's a great book! I love that series.
Yeah, it's so good! I've read it multiple times and I always find something new to appreciate.
Me too! I've read it at least three times and I still find new things to enjoy.
It's a classic for a reason!
I know, right
